The present disastrous President in office is a Muslim who has gathered other Muslims in a very unfair & disproportionate manner around him to lead the country into the sorry state it is in. People have been crying about this unfairness & his party presents Muslim-Muslim ticket!

A Muslim-Muslim ticket is an insult to fairness, equity and justice. It is see finish. It is impunity of the worst kind.
It is disrespect to people of the federal Republic of Nigeria. 

It shows they have little regards for people and think their structure is more valuable.

Let us continue to scrutinise candidates and let them know what we will accept and what is not acceptable. We must also be ready to scrutinise them more when they get into office. 

It is said that eternal vigilance is the price we pay for democracy

We saw another Presidential candidate @officialABAT 's heinous response to the killings of protesters at Lekki Toll Gate and how some defended and still defending it.
That will not give us the Nigeria we yearn for.

We saw a Presidential candidate Atiku Abubakar @atiku deleting and apologising for a tweet made from his account denouncing the killing of a young woman over blasphemy (which implies he supports the killings) and how people defended that. We must never be like that!

We must as citizens be ready to question everyone and everything. If we are not able to or do not want to, we must be ready to allow those who want to question do same.
If you are comfortable with something and others are not. Do not invalidate them.

The video that surfaced of Senator Datti Yusuf Baba-Ahmed @YDBaba_Ahmed is worrisome & citizens have a right to question him and ask for what his stance is today!
I find it perplexing with the fact that he is from a place were homosexuality was openly practiced up to early 1990s

The way as a Muslim you are aghast at homosexuality is the way some are aghast at polygamy which is even a crime in some countries. Imagine that people ask that you be killed or imprisoned because you have 2 wives.
https://t.co/FzEwlxBb4H https://t.co/cjSszAeJyN

My religious injunctions to forbid homosexuality is not a religious injunction on another to forbid homosexuality. Others do not even have religion. 

My religion allows polygamy which is forbidden by some. All I ask is they allow me my choice of polygamy. I shouldn't be punished

As a Muslim I am unapologetic about the fact that my religion which I practice forbids homosexuality but that does not give me the right to call for harm against anyone practicing homosexuality. It is their choice which they have a right to just as I have a right to forbid it

Nigeria as a country must respect everyone's choice and anyone coming to be a President or Vice President must be respectful of other people's choices even if it is against that person's beliefs!
It is what the rule of law is all about.

The excuse of using someone's religion is also not justifiable.
Nigeria is a secular state. There are different religions and even those with no religion.
One person's religious injunctions is not another person's religious injunctions
Many Nigerians are not on the ballot paper. Many Nigerians are not asking you to vote for them. Neither are many Nigerians going to hold sensitive positions.

Dear Citizens,
Getting good governance, accountability and transparency is about ensuring excuses are not made for anyone and no justification of things to suit a narrative. 
We must question even ourselves!
The excuse that many Nigerians think that way is never a good reason!

For over two decades my house has been that place my family, my husband's family (both nuclear and extended) have come for the fun and enjoyment galore.

There were times my house will have over 20 visitors!
Crazy!
Today my house is empty.
Just myself and my husband and the staff

I have had the honour and privilege of being that rich Aunt to my nieces and nephews. Alhamdulillah!
They come to visit and I ensure that I give them the best of times. 
Now they can't come over.

As the first child I have played the role of not just sibling but parent to all my siblings and my house is a rallying centre. Holidays, sallahs etc the house is filled with people. My children had the best of extended family. The house was always filled.
